title: Seafood Linguine
ingredients: 1 bunch of fresh flat-leaf parsley (30g), finely chopped
Zest of ½ a lemon, finely grated
1 fresh red chilli, finely chopped (if using)
Extra virgin olive oil, for finishing
instructions: Cook the dried linguine in a large pan of boiling salted water according to the packet instructions. Drain, reserving a mugful of starchy water.
Slice the squid into 1cm rings.
Sort through the mussels and cockles (or clams), discarding any that aren’t tightly closed.
Slice the scallops.
Peel and finely slice the garlic.
Pick and finely chop the fresh flat-leaf parsley.
Finely grate the zest of ½ a lemon.
Trim and finely chop the fresh red chilli (if using).
Place a large non-stick pan on medium-high heat with olive oil. Add the garlic, chilli, and baby capers. Cook for 1 minute.
Add the clams and mussels. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add the squid, scallops, lemon zest, and parsley. Stir well.
Scrunch in the plum tomatoes by hand. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes, stirring regularly and breaking up the tomatoes.
Stir in the samphire (if using) and squeeze in the lemon juice. Simmer for 1 minute more, or until seafood is perfectly cooked.
Remove the pan from the heat. Carefully pick the meat out of the shells, if desired.
Grate in the Parmesan. Taste and season, adding extra lemon juice if needed.
Toss the cooked linguine into the sauce, loosening with a splash of reserved pasta water if needed.
Finish with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil before serving.

title: Pasta Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve some pasta water before draining.
In a pan, sauté the diced guanciale until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, and black pepper.
Add the cooked pasta to the pan with guanciale. Toss to combine.
Remove the pan from heat and quickly pour in the egg mixture. Toss the pasta until the sauce thickens, adding reserved pasta water as needed.
Season with salt and serve immediately.

title: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to its highest temperature.
Roll out the pizza dough and transfer it to a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange slices of fresh mozzarella on top of the sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and top with fresh basil leaves. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

title: Tiramisu
instructions: In a bowl, beat egg yolks and sugar until pale and creamy.
Add mascarpone cheese to the egg mixture and beat until smooth.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the egg whites into the mascarpone mixture.
Dip ladyfinger cookies into cooled espresso and arrange a layer in a serving dish.
Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the cookies.
Repeat layers until ingredients are used up, ending with a layer of mascarpone.
Dust the top with cocoa powder.
Refrigerate for several hours or overnight before serving.

title: Lasagna
instructions: Cook the lasagna noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, cook the ground beef, onion, and garlic until the beef is browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in the tomato sauce and Italian seasoning. Season with salt and pepper.
In a separate bowl, mix ricotta cheese and grated Parmesan.
Preheat the oven to a moderate temperature.
In a baking dish, layer lasagna noodles, meat sauce, ricotta mixture, and shredded mozzarella. Repeat layers.
Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven until bubbly and golden on top.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

title: Risotto Milanese
instructions: In a small bowl, steep saffron threads in a bit of warm broth.
In a pan, sauté the chopped onion in butter until translucent.
Add Arborio rice to the pan and cook for a minute until rice is coated in butter.
Pour in the white wine and cook until mostly absorbed.
Gradually add the saffron-infused broth, stirring frequently and allowing the liquid to absorb before adding more.
Continue adding broth until the rice is creamy and cooked to your desired consistency.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and let the risotto rest for a few minutes before serving.

title: Nigerian Jollof Rice
instructions: In a pot, heat vegetable oil and sauté chopped onions until translucent.
Add blended red bell peppers and tomatoes. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Stir in tomato paste, thyme, curry powder, white pepper, paprika, and salt.
Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Add parboiled rice and stir to coat with the tomato stew.
Cover the pot and cook on low heat until the rice is cooked and has absorbed the flavors.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve with your choice of protein.

title: Chinese Orange Chicken
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken pieces, cut into bite-sized chunks
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together orange juice, orange zest, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, minced ginger, and minced garlic.
Marinate the chicken pieces in half of the sauce for at least 30 minutes.
In a separate bowl, mix cornstarch and water to create a slurry.
Heat oil in a pan for frying. Coat marinated chicken in cornstarch slurry and fry until golden and crispy.
In another pan, heat the remaining sauce until it thickens.
Toss fried chicken in the thickened sauce until coated.
Serve the orange chicken over rice and garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

title: Kenyan Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
instructions: In a pot, bring water to a boil.
Slowly add maize flour while stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Keep stirring until the mixture thickens.
Cover the pot and let the ugali cook for a few more minutes.
In a separate pan, heat vegetable oil and sauté chopped onions and minced garlic until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Stir in chopped sukuma wiki and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and serve the sukuma wiki alongside the ugali.

title: Ghanaian Kelewele
ingredients: 4 ripe plantains, peeled and cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, mix minced ginger, cayenne pepper, ground coriander, ground cloves, ground nutmeg, and salt to create a spice mix.
Toss the plantain chunks in the spice mix until coated.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the spiced plantains until they are golden and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve the kelewele as a spicy and flavorful snack.

title: Nigerian Pounded Yam and Egusi Soup
ingredients: Assorted meat and fish (e.g., goat meat, beef, fish)
instructions: Prepare the pounded yam by gradually adding yam flour to boiling water, stirring vigorously to achieve a smooth consistency.
In a pot, heat palm oil and sauté chopped onions.
Add egusi seeds and stir until they are well coated.
Add assorted meat and fish. Cook until they are tender.
Stir in ground crayfish, ground pepper, and stock cubes.
Add water to achieve desired soup consistency.
Add vegetables and cook until they wilt.
Season with salt and serve the egusi soup with pounded yam.

title: Chinese Kung Pao Chicken
instructions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin sauce, Chinese black vinegar, cornstarch, and sugar to create a marinade.
Marinate the diced chicken in the sauce for about 20 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and fry dried red chilies until they turn dark.
Remove the chilies from the oil and set them aside.
In the same pan, stir-fry the marinated chicken until cooked.
Add diced bell peppers, minced garlic, and Sichuan peppercorns. Stir-fry briefly.
Add roasted peanuts and the fried dried red chilies.
Season with salt and serve the Kung Pao chicken over rice.

title: Kenyan Nyama Choma
ingredients: 1 kg beef or goat meat, cut into chunks
instructions: In a bowl, mix ginger-garlic paste, paprika, cayenne pepper, ground coriander, salt, pepper, and lemon juice to create a marinade.
Coat the meat chunks with the marinade and let them marinate for a few hours or overnight.
Preheat a grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.
Thread the marinated meat onto skewers and brush with vegetable oil.
Grill the meat on the barbecue, turning occasionally, until it's cooked and has a nice char.
Serve the nyama choma with a side of kachumbari (Kenyan salsa) and ugali.

title: Ghanaian Fufu and Light Soup
ingredients: Assorted meat and fish (e.g., goat meat, tilapia)
Palm nut cream (or palm nut soup base)
instructions: Boil assorted meat and fish until tender. Set aside.
In a pot, sauté chopped onions and minced garlic in palm oil.
Add blended tomatoes, ground ginger, and ground pepper. Cook until the oil separates.
Add palm nut cream and some water to create a soup base.
Season with seasoning cubes and salt.
Add boiled meat and fish to the soup.
Simmer the soup for a few minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve the light soup with fufu.

title: Tom Yum Soup
instructions: Boil 4 cups of water in a pot.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and lime leaves.
Stir in shrimp and chili paste.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

title: Kung Pao Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce and cornstarch.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic and ginger.
Add chicken, peanuts, and bell peppers.
Stir-fry until cooked, and garnish with green onions.

title: Nyama Choma
instructions: Marinate beef with salt and spices.
Grill over an open flame until charred.
Squeeze lemon juice over the meat and serve.

title: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F (230°C).
Roll out pizza dough and spread tomato sauce.
Top with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil leaves.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden.

title: Jollof Rice
instructions: Wash rice thoroughly and set aside.
Prepare tomato stew by blending tomatoes and peppers.
Fry onions in oil, add tomato stew and spices.
Combine rice and tomato stew, cook until rice is tender.

title: Banku and Tilapia
instructions: Prepare banku by mixing corn flour and water.
Season tilapia with spices and grill until cooked.
Serve banku and tilapia with tomato sauce.

title: Green Curry
instructions: Prepare green curry paste with spices.
Cook chicken and vegetables in coconut milk.
Simmer until flavors meld and serve with rice.

title: Sweet and Sour Pork
instructions: Marinate pork with soy sauce and ginger.
Fry pork until golden and set aside.
Stir-fry vegetables, add sweet and sour sauce, and combine with pork.

title: Ugali and Sukuma Wiki
instructions: Boil water and add cornmeal, stirring until thickened.
Sauté kale with onions and tomatoes.
Serve ugali and sukuma wiki together.

title: Risotto al Funghi
instructions: Sauté onions and mushrooms in butter.
Add Arborio rice and white wine.
Gradually add broth, stirring until creamy.
Finish with parmesan and serve.

title: Efo Riro
instructions: Sauté onions and peppers in palm oil.
Add spinach and tomato stew, simmer until cooked.
Serve efo riro with rice or fufu.

title: Red Red
instructions: Boil black-eyed peas until tender.
Sauté plantains and peppers in palm oil.
Combine peas, plantains, and tomato stew.
Serve red red with fried plantains.

title: Massaman Curry
instructions: Simmer beef in coconut milk until tender.
Add massaman curry paste and potatoes.
Stir in peanuts and tamarind paste.
Serve with rice and garnish with cilantro.

title: Dim Sum
instructions: Prepare various dim sum fillings.
Assemble and steam dumplings until cooked.
Serve with dipping sauces.

title: Pilau Rice
instructions: Sauté onions and spices until fragrant.
Add rice and cook with broth and tomatoes.
Simmer until rice is fluffy and serve.

title: Pounded Yam and Egusi Soup
instructions: Pound yam until smooth and stretchy.
Prepare egusi soup by combining ingredients.
Serve pounded yam with egusi soup.
